definition: to rein in/to compel/to force/to carve/to engrave/(literary) to command/to lead/bridle/(physics) abbr. for 勒克斯[le4 ke4 si1], lux
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.chinese: 帕勒克斯同样也欢迎当地的学生前来。

sentences.english: Buck had been purposely placed between Dave and Sol- leks so that he might receive instruction.
sentences.chinese: 巴克被有意安排在达弗和索勒克斯之间接受教训。

sentences.english: Luxmoore was shocked to realize that he had left it in the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 勒克斯穆尔十分震惊地想到，他把它落在出租车上了。

sentences.english: It needs to be set at a strength of at least 2500 lux to be effective.
sentences.chinese: 它需要订于一个实力至少2500勒克斯是有效的。

definition: Lord Kelvin 1824-1907, British physicist (William Thomson)/Kelvin (temperature scale)
sievert (Sv), unit of radiation damage used in radiotherapy
Hertz (name)/Heinrich Hertz (1857-1894), German physicist and meteorologist, pioneer of electromagnetic radiation
